result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Joshua C Nance

records.addlTxt:
Defendant Joshua C Nance appeared by video.  Attorney Michael B Plaisted appeared by video for Joshua C Nance.  Attorney Corey R. Flynn in court for Joshua C Nance.  Prosecuting attorney Arthur Kenneth Thexton in court for the State of Wisconsin. Attorney Flynn requested to be Withdrawn from case. Court GRANTED Attorney Flynn's request. Attorney Michael B Plaisted appointed as counsel. Previous counsel to provide counsel with Discovery. Court ordered case adjourned for Status Conference. Case remains calendared in Branch 30.
Scheduling conference scheduled for November 29, 2022 at 08:30 am.
Order to allow defense counsel to withdraw, signed

Defendant Joshua C Nance appeared by video.  Attorney Corey R. Flynn appeared by video for Joshua C Nance.  Prosecuting attorney Sarah Dahdouh in court for the State of Wisconsin. 
Case in court for a status conference. Defendant did not complete a TAD evaluation. Defense requests a motion hearing. Briefs to be filed by Defense by 10/10/22 and State's response to be filed by 11/10/22.
Case adjourned.
Motion hearing scheduled for November 15, 2022 at 02:30 pm.

Defendant Joshua C Nance in court with attorney Corey R. Flynn.  Sarah Dahdouh appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Joshua C Nance appeared by video means with Attorney.
Case in court for a status conference. Defense is in receipt of discovery and offer. Case may be in DPA posture.
Case adjourned.  Status conference scheduled for September 9, 2022 at 01:30 pm.

Defendant Joshua C Nance in court.  Erika Strebel appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Case in court for pre-trial conference. Defendant may qualify for SPD appointment. Defendant instructed to contact Public Defenders office. 
Case adjourned back to br 30 for status of counsel.  Status conference scheduled for August 8, 2022 at 09:00 am.
No possession of dangerous weapons or firearms.

Defendant Joshua C Nance in court.  Katrina Amy Voge appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Defendant is advised that this case is assigned to Judge Richards, Branch 30.  
Court reviewed the complaint and found probable cause. Defendant received a copy of the complaint and was advised of right to counsel and maximum penalties. Court entered a plea of not guilty on behalf of the Defendant.  Court reserves Defendant's right to file a substitution of judge pursuant to Sec. 971.20 right to challenge probable cause and to have complaint read until Defendant's next scheduled court appearance. Defendant was given a referral to the Public Defender's Office. Defendant MAY be Public Defender eligible.  
The case is adjourned for a Pretrial Conference in Br. 30.  Pre-trial conference scheduled for July 14, 2022 at 01:30 pm.
Summons mailed.  Defendant ordered into room 221 Safety Building on 6-24-2022 @2p
